Module contents

Module with method to embed graphs using a precomputed embedding.

class grape.embiggen.transformers.CorpusTransformer(synonyms: Optional[Dict] = None, language: str = 'english', tokenizer_method: str = 'nltk', apply_stemming: bool = True, remove_stop_words: bool = True, remove_punctuation: bool = True, remove_digits: bool = False, extra_stop_words: Optional[Set[str]] = None, min_word_length: int = 2, min_sequence_length: int = 0, min_count: int = 0, max_count: int = inf, to_lower_case: bool = True, verbose: bool = True, processes: Optional[int] = None, use_multiprocessing: bool = True)

Bases: object

Simple class to tekenize textual corpuses.

fit(texts: List[str])

Fit the transformer.

Parameters

texts (List[str],) – The texts to use for the fitting.

Raises

  • ValueError, – If there are NaN values within given texts.

  • ValueError, – If there are non string values within given texts.

class grape.embiggen.transformers.EdgeTransformer(method: str = 'Hadamard', aligned_node_mapping: bool = False, support_mirrored_strategy: bool = False)

Bases: object

EdgeTransformer class to convert edges to edge embeddings.

fit(embedding: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame)

Fit the model.

Parameters

embedding (pd.DataFrame,) – Embedding to use to fit the transformer. This is a pandas DataFrame and NOT a numpy array because we need to be able to remap correctly the vector embeddings in case of graphs that do not respect the same internal node mapping but have the same node set. It is possible to remap such graphs using Ensmallen’s remap method but it may be less intuitive to users.

Raises

ValueError, – If the given method is None there is no need to call the fit method.

property method: str

Return the used edge embedding method.

methods = {'Hadamard': <function EdgeTransformer.<lambda>>, 'Sum': <function EdgeTransformer.<lambda>>, 'Average': <function EdgeTransformer.<lambda>>, 'L1': <function EdgeTransformer.<lambda>>, 'AbsoluteL1': <function EdgeTransformer.<lambda>>, 'L2': <function EdgeTransformer.<lambda>>, 'Concatenate': <function EdgeTransformer.<lambda>>, None: <function EdgeTransformer.<lambda>>}
property numeric_node_ids: bool

Return whether the transformer returns numeric node IDs.

transform(sources: List[str], destinations: List[str]) → numpy.ndarray

Return embedding for given edges using provided method.

Parameters

  • sources (List[str],) – List of source nodes whose embedding is to be returned.

  • destinations (List[str],) – List of destination nodes whose embedding is to be returned.

Raises

ValueError, – If embedding is not fitted.

Returns

Return type

Numpy array of embeddings.

class grape.embiggen.transformers.GraphTransformer(method: str = 'Hadamard', aligned_node_mapping: bool = False, support_mirrored_strategy: bool = False)

Bases: object

GraphTransformer class to convert graphs to edge embeddings.

fit(embedding: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame)

Fit the model.

Parameters

embedding (pd.DataFrame,) – Embedding to use to fit the transformer. This is a pandas DataFrame and NOT a numpy array because we need to be able to remap correctly the vector embeddings in case of graphs that do not respect the same internal node mapping but have the same node set. It is possible to remap such graphs using Ensmallen’s remap method but it may be less intuitive to users.

property method: str

Return the used edge embedding method.

property numeric_node_ids: bool

Return whether the transformer returns numeric node IDs.

transform(graph: Union[Graph, numpy.ndarray, List[List[str]], List[List[int]]]) → numpy.ndarray

Return edge embedding for given graph using provided method.

Parameters

graph (Union[Graph, np.ndarray, List[List[str]], List[List[int]]],) – The graph whose edges are to embed. It can either be an Graph or a list of lists of edges.

Raises

ValueError, – If embedding is not fitted.

Returns

Return type

Numpy array of embeddings.

class grape.embiggen.transformers.LinkPredictionTransformer(method: str = 'Hadamard', aligned_node_mapping: bool = False, support_mirrored_strategy: bool = False)

Bases: object

LinkPredictionTransformer class to convert graphs to edge embeddings.

fit(embedding: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame)

Fit the model.

Parameters

embedding (pd.DataFrame,) – Embedding to use to fit the transformer. This is a pandas DataFrame and NOT a numpy array because we need to be able to remap correctly the vector embeddings in case of graphs that do not respect the same internal node mapping but have the same node set. It is possible to remap such graphs using Ensmallen’s remap method but it may be less intuitive to users.

transform(positive_graph: Union[Graph, numpy.ndarray, List[List[str]], List[List[int]]], negative_graph: Union[Graph, numpy.ndarray, List[List[str]], List[List[int]]], random_state: int = 42) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray]

Return edge embedding for given graph using provided method.

Parameters

  • positive_graph (Union[Graph, List[List[str]], List[List[int]]],) – The graph whose edges are to be embedded and labeled as positives. It can either be an Graph or a list of lists of edges.

  • negative_graph (Union[Graph, List[List[str]], List[List[int]]],) – The graph whose edges are to be embedded and labeled as positives. It can either be an Graph or a list of lists of edges.

  • random_state (int = 42,) – The random state to use to shuffle the labels.

Raises

ValueError, – If embedding is not fitted.

Returns

Return type

Tuple with X and y values.

class grape.embiggen.transformers.NodeTransformer(numeric_node_ids: bool = False, aligned_node_mapping: bool = False, support_mirrored_strategy: bool = False)

Bases: object

NodeTransformer class to convert nodes to edge embeddings.

fit(embedding: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame)

Fit the model.

Parameters

embedding (pd.DataFrame,) – Embedding to use to fit the transformer. This is a pandas DataFrame and NOT a numpy array because we need to be able to remap correctly the vector embeddings in case of graphs that do not respect the same internal node mapping but have the same node set. It is possible to remap such graphs using Ensmallen’s remap method but it may be less intuitive to users.

property numeric_node_ids: bool

Return whether the transformer returns numeric node IDs.

transform(nodes: Union[List[str], List[int]]) → numpy.ndarray

Return embeddings from given node.

Parameters

nodes (Union[List[str], List[int]],) – List of nodes whose embedding is to be returned. By default this should be a list of strings, if the aligned_node_mapping is setted, then this methods also accepts a list of ints.

Raises

ValueError, – If embedding is not fitted.

Returns

Return type

Numpy array of embeddings.
